channel.description: Recent content in Sysgrammer's Website on Sysgrammer's PSA

item.title: 2D array with pointers
item.description: Concept In this case we’re not gonna be using as quote-on-quote multidimensional arrays. We’re gonna be using a pointer to an array and then Use the pointer offset “like” an array. Essentially what I am trying to get at is the follwing: int (*my_arr)[] This declares my array as a pointer to an array of integers. And to rid us of the confusion we’re gonna use a typedef some type to type[ARRAY]

item.title: Daily Updates
item.description: Spent day stuyding Didn’t program Realised how much I have to cope with studies. See ya

item.title: A Fresh Look on my website
item.description: While talking to a good friend of mine, He recommended me a static site generator called Hugo. It is a quite a powerful tool and has many themes and support for templates from other web programming languages/markup languages. I won’t go into much detail now but it is how it is. Anyways, we both found this cool theme that we’re using right now and it is called hugo.386. It took me about 2-3 Hours to configure everything right along with some trial and error on some areas and now we’re here.

item.title: About
item.description: I like to do systems programming and other stuff. I’m interesting in Operating Systems, Reverse Engineering, backends and other lower level stuff. I mainly program in C. Contact Email: sysgrammer@protonmail.com Github: sysgrammer Twitter: @sysgrammer

item.title: Daily Updates
item.description: Learnt Linked Lists (in C ). Need practice Renovated website. We (re-)launched(?) So… Yesterday I said I would read Beej’s guide and try to finish that in 2-3 days. Well, I didn’t even read the guide, I just spent half of my day randomly spending time on Together C & C++ Discord and renovating my website. The took a small afternoon nap. The started learning Data structures, well to be more precise Linked Lists, to be even more precise Singly Linked Lists.

item.title: Daily Updates
item.description: Re-started reading Beej’s Guide to Network Programming Added token exception handling to bot Okay Now I’ve talked about what I’ve been doing and will do, I’m thinking that mall0cd’s library might need a re write due to an issue caused by libjansson.h. I planned on helping him continue his work but after some debugging with my bot we realised that library was fundamentally flawed due to the JSON parser as indicated by valgrind.

item.title: Lispy Documentation
item.description: Introduction This webpage contains the documentation of my lisp implementation which was invented by Daniel Holden. The documentation is divided into sections and the index is available after this introduction. This implementation is very different from all the typical lisps and there are some noticable differences. This guide assumes that you atleast know what Lisps are. However if you don’t, I recommend searching about it. It is not completely necessary to understand lisps for you to use Lispy but a little knowledge won’t do you any harm.
